item.title: OpenAI confirms Operator Agent is now more accurate with o3
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI says Operator Agent now uses the o3 model, which means it's now significantly better at reasoning capabilities. [...]

item.title: Dozens of malicious packages on NPM collect host and network data
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: 60 packages have been discovered in the NPM index that attempt to collect sensitive host and network data and send it to a Discord webhook controlled by the threat actor. [...]

item.title: Hacker steals $223 million in Cetus Protocol cryptocurrency heist
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The decentralized exchange Cetus Protocol announced that hackers have stolen $223 million in cryptocurrency and is offering a deal to stop all legal action if the funds are returned. [...]

item.title: FBI warns of Luna Moth extortion attacks targeting law firms
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The FBI warned that an extortion gang known as the Silent Ransom Group has been targeting U.S. law firms over the last two years in callback phishing and social engineering attacks. [...]

item.title: TikTok videos now push infostealer malware in ClickFix attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Cybercriminals are using TikTok videos to trick users into infecting themselves with Vidar and StealC information-stealing malware in ClickFix attacks. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 Notepad gets AI-powered text writing capabilities
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is testing a new AI-powered text generation feature in Notepad that can let Windows Insiders create content based on custom prompts. [...]

item.title: Police takes down 300 servers in ransomware supply-chain crackdown
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: In the latest phase of Operation Endgame, an international law enforcement operation, national authorities from seven countries seized 300 servers and 650 domains used to launch ransomware attacks. [...]

item.title: Claude 4 benchmarks show improvements, but context is still 200K
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Today, OpenAI rival Anthropic announced Claude 4 models, which are significantly better than Claude 3 in benchmarks, but we're left disappointed with the same 200,000 context window limit. [...]

item.title: US indicts leader of Qakbot botnet linked to ransomware attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: The U.S. government has indicted Russian national Rustam Rafailevich Gallyamov, the leader of the Qakbot botnet malware operation that compromised over 700,000 computers and enabled ransomware attacks. [...]

item.title: Hackers use fake Ledger apps to steal Mac users’ seed phrases
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cybercriminal campaigns are using fake Ledger apps to target macOS users and their digital assets by deploying malware that attempts to steal seed phrases that protect access to digital cryptocurrency wallets. [...]

item.title: Police arrests 270 dark web vendors, buyers in global crackdown
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Police arrested 270 suspects following an international law enforcement action codenamed 'Operation RapTor' that targeted dark web vendors and customers from ten countries. [...]

item.title: Ivanti EPMM flaw exploited by Chinese hackers to breach govt agencies
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Chinese hackers have been exploiting a remote code execution flaw in Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) to breach high-profile organizations worldwide. [...]

item.title: Chinese hackers breach US local governments using Cityworks zero-day
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Chinese-speaking hackers have exploited a now-patched Trimble Cityworks zero-day to breach multiple local governing bodies across the United States. [...]
